spell.name: Amanuensis
entries: Choose any non-magical writing you can see within range. That writing is magically copied onto a sheet of blank paper you are holding. This spell copies 250 words per minute and creates a perfect duplicate of the original. It does not translate the text or make it clearer.

Illustrations or magical writings (such as the text of a spellbook, a spell scroll, or a glyph of warding) cannot be copied by this spell. If the original text contains both normal writing and magical writing or illustrations (such as a letter with a glyph of warding or a drawing in one corner), only the normal text is copied.

You must provide blank paper, parchment, or another writing supplement for the spell to copy text onto. If a blank sheet would become filled with copied text as a result of this spell, you must cast the spell again with a new blank sheet of paper to continue copying.

spell.name: Amaterasu

components.m: a pinch of dust from an immolated vampire

entries: You exhale black flame toward a target creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target is engulfed in numbing black flames and becomes {@condition poisoned}. The target must make a successful Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns for the duration, or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} for each failure. If the target makes three successful Constitution saves, the fire vanishes as soon as it came, and the target is no longer poisoned.
On the targetâ€™s turn, anyone adjacent to it must make a successful Dexterity saving throw or be engulfed in Amaterasu's wreathing black flames.

Anyone killed by Amaterasu is disintegrated (as if by the {@italic disintegrate} spell). A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

When not applied to a creature, Amaterasu's flames are said to burn for seven days and seven nights, but the black flame will not spread as normal fire would, instead remaining still. Like an eternal light.

spell.name: Aura Sight
entries: You refocus your sight to see into the energy that surrounds all creatures. This aura can be used in many ways, including gaining insight into the true nature of a creature, or key elements such as movement that can assist you in combat.
When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects to transpire:
{@bold Assess Foe}. You analyze the aura of one creature you see. You learn whether it has more or less hit points than you, and all its immunities, resistances, and vulnerabilities.
{@bold Read Mood}. You learn a one-word summary of the emotional state of up to six creatures you can see, such as happy, confused, afraid, or violent.

spell.name: Breath of Shadow
entries: You breathe forth a cloud of impenetrable shadow which exhales from your mouth and spreads itself around a point you can see within range. It then manifests into the shape of a cylinder with a radius of 10-feet and a height of 20-feet that is lightly obscured.
A creature which starts it turn or moves into the area for the first time on a turn must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage.
The body of a creature killed by this spell becomes withered beyond recognition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 5th level or higher spell slot. The necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Glacial Path
entries: You cause a pulse of frost energy to burst out from you in a line 15-feet wide and 30 feet long, covering the ground in the line in slick ice for the duration. Hostile creatures treat this ice as difficult terrain.
When you first cast the spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see. When those creatures move on the ice, they only need to expend 1 foot of movement for every 2 feet they move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the length of the line creases by 30 feet and the width of the line increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Frost Lance
entries: You hurl a frigid lance forged from ice at a creature you can see within range. Make a spell attack roll against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if its movement speed has been reduced or is 0. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 5d12} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3th.

spell.name: Ocean Pulse
entries: You attempt to hit a creature within range with a blast of salty water, making a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Aqua Blast
entries: A blast of gushing water pulled from the depths of the elemental plane of water shoots from you hands in a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 6d12} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 30 feet directly away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is only pushed 15 feet directly away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Crown of Crystal
entries: You create 3 shards of transparent crystal that orbit your head. As a bonus action, you can launch one of the crystals at a creature within 60 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} piercing damage. Whether or not the crystal hits, that crystal is expended and shatters. The spell ends early once all crystals have been expended.
The number of crystals you can create with this spell increases to 4 at 5th level, 5 at 11th level, and 6 at 17th level.

spell.name: Desecrate Earth
entries: You invoke a foul curse upon the land, desecrating it beyond the Material realm and transforming it into your own personal territory. When you cast this spell, a 30-foot radius of ground within range withers and uproots itself, twisting and dancing to the tune of a mysterious shadow.
Undead creatures standing or flying above this ground have advantage on effects which turn undead. If a creature already has advantage on such effects, they instead gain immunity to them.

In addition, at the start of their turns, any undead on this ground gain {@dice 1d10} temporary hit points. Undead created through animate dead gain temporary hit points at the start of the caster's turn.

After you break concentration on this spell, the ground loses its magical effects. However, it remains forever tainted: bearing fewer plants, turning blackened and withered, and becoming detectable through a paladin's divine sense.

spell.name: Dimension Slice
entries: You manifest psychic energy into the palm of your hand, creating an invisible and intangible psionic disc that directly attacks at your opponent's mind.

Make a ranged spell attack against a target. On a hit, the disc connects. The target takes {@dice 4d4} psychic damage and must make a Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you inflict a powerful nocebo that physically causes their brain synapses to fire rampantly. The target's movement speed becomes 0 and they have disadvantage on attack rolls and Strength saving throws until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above the 2nd.

spell.name: Ego Whip
entries: You lash the mind of one creature you can see within range, filling it with despair. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Id Insinuation
entries: You unleash a torrent of conflicting desires in the mind of one creature you can see within range, impairing its ability to make decisions. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be incapacitated. At the end of each of its turns, it takes {@damage 1d10} psychic damage, and it can then make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Intellect Fortress
entries: You create a faintly shimmering barrier of protective psychic power around you. For the duration, you have advantage on all saving throws.
When another creature that you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to allow them to reroll the save. They must use the new roll.

spell.name: Manifest Air
entries: You begin to manipulate the air with your psychic force, allowing you an intimate control over both the flow of wind and the surrounding oxygen to an innate and precise degree.

Until your concentration ends, whenever you move on your turn, you can fly up to 20 feet, but you must end your turn on a solid surface. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and when a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force the creature to repeat the attack roll against itself.

spell.name: Mass Repair Damage
entries: You transmute the structure of constructs to repair them out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six constructs in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on other creatures.  This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Memory of Ash
entries: You touch the corpse of a dead humanoid that is not an undead. Over the duration of this spell's casting time, you slowly reduce that creature to ash, as their body vacates to the pressures of your necromancy and scatters to the winds.
Upon completion, you learn one of the following things about the creature, which may or may not assist in your journey:
{@bold Eyes of Ash.} You receive a vision of the creature's death starting 10 seconds before its demise (from the creature's perspective).
{@bold Soul of Ash.} One important, yet simple thing about the creature of your choice. Examples of this may include what the creature loved the most, what they despised, and their worries.
{@bold Heart of Ash.} The goal the creature was trying to achieve prior to its death (if any).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, you learn one additional Ash for every level above 2nd. In addition, you can choose Eyes of Ash multiple times. When you do, you increase the length of the vision by 10 additional seconds.

spell.name: Mental Barrier

time.condition: which you take when you are forced to make an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw

entries: You protect your mind with a wall of looping, repetitive thought. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

spell.name: Miasma of Death
entries: Choose either a corpse or an undead creature under your control within range. The target explodes into a cloud of dense, purple, toxic gas. The explosion is as unsightly as it is uproarious, blistering the skin of nearby creatures and sending those who need to breathe into massive coughing fits.
Immediately upon this spell's casting, the target is reduced to an unrecognizable husk. If the target was an undead creature under your control, that undead is instantly killed.

Any creature within 10 feet of the explosion must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 3d6} poison or necrotic damage (your choice), or half as much on a successful save. If the creature failed the save, that creature is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 2nd.

spell.name: Nightmare Sphere
entries: You erect a 5-foot diameter black sphere at an unoccupied point within range. The sphere is semi-solid (treated as difficult terrain) and provides half-cover when hid behind.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere 20-feet in any direction within range. A creature who starts its turn within 10-feet of the sphere, or touches it for the first time in a turn, must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and the sphere morphs to reflect one of their darkest fears.

A creature who is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is knocked unconscious, stabilized, and becomes immune to this spell for as long as they remain unconscious. In addition, that creature experiences horrible nightmares for the next {@dice 1d4} days.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: On/Off
entries: This cantrip allows you to activate or deactivate any electronic device within range, as long as the device has a clearly defined on or off function that can be easily accessed from the outside of the device. Any device that requires a software-based shutdown sequence to activate or deactivate cannot be affected by on/off.

spell.name: Psionic Blast
entries: You unleash a destructive wave of mental power in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d8} force damage, is pushed 10 feet directly away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Psionic Negation Field
entries: You channel your inner psionic power, unleashing force a burst of negatory energy that crushes and demolishes object that attempt to reach its inner sanctum. Your base AC becomes 12 + your spellcasting modifier. The spell ends if you don armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Psionic Pulse
entries: You release a pulse of psionic energy centered at your fingertips, which travels in waves until it strikes the first creature in its path. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, the synapses in the creature's brain are temporarily hampered, making communication between the different hemispheres of the brain almost impossible.
Until the end of your next turn, that creature is {@condition deafened}, and cannot speak or cast spells that require verbal components. In addition, that creature cannot take the Disengage action.

spell.name: Psychic Barrier
entries: You deploy barriers using your mental fortitude around your allies; makeshift auras of psychic energy that repel attacks and create an invisible wall between the targeted creatures and their opponents.
Choose up to three creatures within range (including you). Those selected creatures gain a +2 bonus to their AC, and advantage on Wisdom saving throws for the duration.
If a creature moves from the space it was standing when the spell was cast, or if jumps, flies, or otherwise leaves solid ground, the spell's effects end for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus to AC increases by 1 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

spell.name: Psychic Crush
entries: You overload the mind of one creature you can see within range, filling its psyche with discordant emotions. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 12d6} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.
The stunned target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Putrid Plague

m.text: a cup of blood, a parasite egg and herbs worth 150 gp, all of which the spell consumes

entries: You touch the corpse of a Large or smaller creature, birthing life to a myriad of parasites and maggots that immediately begin feasting on the corpse by collecting in the creature's chest cavity. If the corpse is disturbed at any point after this spell's casting, its chest blows open.
Any creature within 10-feet of the disturbed corpse must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 4d6} piercing damage and becomes infested with a parasite.

The parasite counts as a disease and deals {@dice 2d6} poison damage to its host at the end of every hour. It can be removed by another creature as part of a 30-minute long operation. In order to perform the procedure, the creature must have a cutting instrument and make a successful DC 12 + your spellcasting modifier Dexterity (Medicine) check. On a failed check, the creature takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage, and the parasite is not removed.

If the host is killed by this parasite, it then begins to birth forth a myriad of parasites and maggots inside the host's body. One hour prior to the creature's death, it will start spreading the disease upon disturbing as if this spell was casted on it. Burning the corpse, disintegrating it, or killing the infected creature with radiant damage prevents this from occurring.

spell.name: Reconstruct
entries: Choose a construct that you can see within range. You greatly repair it, causing it to regain 60 hit points. This spell also grants the target the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell for 2 rounds. This effect does not stack with Haste, and does not impose the penalties of {@spell haste} when this effect expires. This spell has no effect on other creatures. This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Repair Damage
entries: A construct you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on other creatures. This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Scythe of the Reaper
entries: You form a scythe of necrotic energy in your hands, constructed from the lingering regrets and miasma in the air. You then swing it at a creature in range, cutting a line from this world to the next.
The creature you target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creatures takes {@dice 8d6} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

A humanoid who is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell immediately dies, as its flesh it stripped from its bones and its skeleton rises to serve you. The skeleton rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn in initiative.
The skeleton becomes inanimate after one hour, or once it drops to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 4th level or higher spell slot. The necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Siphon Vitality
entries: Target a creature that you can see within range that is not a construct or undead. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage.
On a failed save, you can add a {@dice 1d4} to the next saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

spell.name: Swarm of Decay
entries: You call forth a swarm of ravenous, decaying insects to spring to life at your fingertips. At your command, they fly over to a creature within range. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 1d6} poison damage, or half as much on a successful one.

On subsequent turns, you can direct the swarm to attack another creature within range, or move back to you as a bonus action. If you do not direct the swarm at the end of your turn, they instead attack the same creature without need of an action. If the swarm ever leaves your range, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Thought Shield
entries: You weave a clouding veil over the mind of one creature you touch. For the duration, the target's mind can't be read or detected, creatures can't telepathically communicate with the target unless the target allows it, and the target has advantage on saving throws against any effect that would determine whether it is telling the truth.
